   20: -module(code_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   26: -export([set_path/1, get_path/1, add_path/1, add_paths/1, del_path/1,
   27: 	 replace_path/1, load_file/1, load_abs/1,
   28:          ensure_loaded/1, ensure_loaded_many/1, ensure_loaded_many_kill/1,
   29:          ensure_loaded_bad_case/1,
   30: 	 delete/1, purge/1, purge_many_exits/0, purge_many_exits/1,
   31:          soft_purge/1, is_loaded/1, all_loaded/1, all_available/1,
   32: 	 load_binary/1, dir_req/1, object_code/1, set_path_file/1,
   33: 	 upgrade/0, upgrade/1,
   34: 	 sticky_dir/1, pa_pz_option/1, add_del_path/1,
   35: 	 dir_disappeared/1, ext_mod_dep/1, clash/1,
   36: 	 where_is_file/1,
   37: 	 purge_stacktrace/1, mult_lib_roots/1, bad_erl_libs/1,
   38: 	 code_archive/1, code_archive2/1, on_load/1, on_load_binary/1,
   39: 	 on_load_embedded/1, on_load_errors/1, on_load_update/1,
   40:          on_load_trace_on_load/1,
   41: 	 on_load_purge/1, on_load_self_call/1, on_load_pending/1,
   42: 	 on_load_deleted/1, on_load_deadlock/1,
   43: 	 big_boot_embedded/1,
   44:          module_status/1,
   45: 	 get_mode/1, code_path_cache/1,
   46: 	 normalized_paths/1, mult_embedded_flags/1]).
   47: 
   48: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   49: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   50: 
   51: %% error_logger
   52: -export([init/1,
   53: 	 handle_event/2, handle_call/2, handle_info/2,
   54: 	 terminate/2]).
   55: 
   56: -export([compile_load/4]).
   57: 
   58: suite() ->
   59:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   60:      {timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   61: 
   62: all() ->
   63:     [set_path, get_path, add_path, add_paths, del_path,
   64:      replace_path, load_file, load_abs,
   65:      ensure_loaded, ensure_loaded_many, ensure_loaded_many_kill,
   66:      ensure_loaded_bad_case,
   67:      delete, purge, purge_many_exits, soft_purge, is_loaded, all_loaded,
   68:      all_available, load_binary, dir_req, object_code, set_path_file,
   69:      upgrade, code_path_cache,
   70:      sticky_dir, pa_pz_option, add_del_path, dir_disappeared,
   71:      ext_mod_dep, clash, where_is_file,
   72:      purge_stacktrace, mult_lib_roots,
   73:      bad_erl_libs, code_archive, code_archive2, on_load,
   74:      on_load_binary, on_load_embedded, on_load_errors,
   75:      {group, sequence},
   76:      on_load_purge, on_load_self_call, on_load_pending,
   77:      on_load_deleted, on_load_deadlock,
   78:      module_status,
   79:      big_boot_embedded, get_mode, normalized_paths,
   80:      mult_embedded_flags].
   81: 
   82: %% These need to run in order
   83: groups() -> [{sequence, [sequence], [on_load_update,
   84:                                      on_load_trace_on_load]}].
   85: 
   86: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   87: 	Config.
   88: 
   89: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   90: 	Config.
   91: 
   92: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   93:     %% The compiler will no longer create a Beam file if
   94:     %% the module name does not match the filename, so
   95:     %% we must compile to a binary and write the Beam file
   96:     %% ourselves.
   97:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
   98:     File = filename:join(Dir, "code_a_test"),
   99:     {ok,code_b_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  100:     ok = file:write_file(File++".beam", Code),
  101:     Config.
  102: 
  103: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  104:     Config.
  105: 
  106: -define(TESTMOD, test_dummy).
  107: -define(TESTMODSTR, "test_dummy").
  108: -define(TESTMODSRC, ?TESTMODSTR ".erl").
  109: -define(TESTMODOBJ, ?TESTMODSTR ".beam").
  110: 
  111: init_per_testcase(big_boot_embedded, Config) ->
  112:     case catch crypto:start() of
  113: 	ok ->
  114: 	    init_per_testcase(do_big_boot_embedded, Config);
  115: 	_Else ->
  116: 	    {skip, "Needs crypto!"}
  117:     end;
  118: init_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config0) ->
  119:     LibRoot = code:lib_dir(),
  120:     LinkName = filename:join(LibRoot, "on_load_app-1.0"),
  121:     Config = [{link_name,LinkName}|Config0],
  122:     init_per_testcase(Config);
  123: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  124:     init_per_testcase(Config).
  125: 
  126: init_per_testcase(Config) ->
  127:     P = code:get_path(),
  128:     [{code_path, P}|Config].
  129: 
  130: 
  131: end_per_testcase(module_status, Config) ->
  132:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  133:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  134:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  135:     file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ),
  136:     file:delete(?TESTMODSRC),
  137:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  138: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == mult_lib_roots;
  139: 				  TC == big_boot_embedded ->
  140:     {ok, HostName} = inet:gethostname(),
  141:     NodeName = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(TC)++"@"++HostName),
  142:     test_server:stop_node(NodeName),
  143:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  144: end_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config) ->
  145:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
  146:     _ = del_link(LinkName),
  147:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  148: end_per_testcase(upgrade, Config) ->
  149:     %% Make sure tracing is turned off even if the test times out.
  150:     erlang:trace_pattern({error_handler,undefined_function,3}, false, [global]),
  151:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
  152:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  153: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  154:     end_per_testcase(Config).
  155: 
  156: end_per_testcase(Config) ->
  157:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  158:     P=proplists:get_value(code_path, Config),
  159:     true=code:set_path(P),
  160:     P=code:get_path(),
  161:     ok.
  162: 
  163: set_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  164:     P = code:get_path(),
  165:     NonExDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), test_server:temp_name("hej")),
  166:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:set_path({a})),
  167:     {error, bad_directory} = (catch code:set_path([{a}])),
  168:     {error, bad_directory} = code:set_path(NonExDir),
  169:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  170:     true = code:set_path(P), % set the same path again.
  171:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  172:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  173:     true = code:set_path([LibDir | P]),
  174:     [LibDir | P] = code:get_path(),
  175:     true = code:set_path([LibDir]),
  176:     [LibDir] = code:get_path(),
  177:     ok.
  178: 
  179: get_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  180:     P = code:get_path(),
  181:     %% test that all directories are strings (lists).
  182:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  183: 	    (Dir) when is_list(Dir) -> false;
  184: 	    (_) -> true
  185: 	end, P),
  186:     ok.
  187: 
  188: add_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  189:     P = code:get_path(),
  190:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_path({})),
  191:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_patha({})),
  192:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_pathz({})),
  193:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_path("xyz"),
  194:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_patha("xyz"),
  195:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_pathz("xyz"),
  196:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  197:     true = code:add_path(LibDir),
  198:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  199:     code:set_path(P),
  200:     true = code:add_pathz(LibDir),
  201:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  202:     code:set_path(P),
  203:     true = code:add_patha(LibDir),
  204:     [LibDir|_] = code:get_path(),
  205:     code:set_path(P),
  206:     ok.
  207: 
  208: add_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  209:     P = code:get_path(),
  210:     ok = code:add_paths([{}]),
  211:     ok = code:add_pathsa([{}]),
  212:     ok = code:add_pathsz([{}]),
  213:     ok = code:add_paths(["xyz"]),
  214:     ok = code:add_pathsa(["xyz"]),
  215:     ok = code:add_pathsz(["xyz"]),
  216:     P = code:get_path(), % check that no directory is added.
  217: 
  218:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  219:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir]),
  220:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  221:     code:set_path(P),
  222:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir]),
  223:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  224:     code:set_path(P),
  225:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir]),
  226:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  227:     code:set_path(P),
  228: 
  229:     RootDir = code:root_dir(),
  230:     Res = P ++ [LibDir, RootDir],
  231:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, RootDir]),
  232:     Res = code:get_path(),
  233:     code:set_path(P),
  234:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, RootDir]),
  235:     Res = code:get_path(),
  236:     code:set_path(P),
  237:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, RootDir]),
  238:     [RootDir, LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  239:     code:set_path(P),
  240: 
  241:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  242:     Res1 = P ++ [LibDir],
  243:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  244:     code:set_path(P),
  245:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  246:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  247:     code:set_path(P),
  248:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  249:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  250:     code:set_path(P),
  251:     ok.
  252: 
  253: del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  254:     P = code:get_path(),
  255:     try
  256: 	del_path_1(P)
  257:     after
  258: 	code:set_path(P)
  259:     end.
  260: 
  261: del_path_1(P) ->
  262:     io:format("Initial code:get_path()=~p~n",[P]),
  263:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:del_path(3)),
  264:     false = code:del_path(my_dummy_name),
  265:     false = code:del_path("/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  266:     Dir = filename:join([code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin"]),
  267:     io:format("kernel dir: ~p~n",[Dir]),
  268: 
  269:     true = code:del_path(kernel),
  270:     NewP = code:get_path(),
  271:     io:format("Path after removing 'kernel':~p~n",[NewP]),
  272:     ReferenceP = lists:delete(Dir,P),
  273:     io:format("Reference path:~p~n",[ReferenceP]),
  274:     NewP = ReferenceP, % check that dir is deleted
  275:     code:set_path(P),
  276: 
  277:     %% An superfluous "/" should also work.
  278:     true = code:del_path("kernel/"),
  279:     NewP = ReferenceP,			   % check that dir is deleted
  280:     code:set_path(P),
  281: 
  282:     true = code:del_path(Dir),
  283:     NewP1 = code:get_path(),
  284:     NewP1 = lists:delete(Dir,P), % check that dir is deleted
  285:     ok.
  286: 
  287: replace_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  288:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  289:     P = code:get_path(),
  290:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:replace_path(3,"")),
  291:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(dummy_name,""),
  292:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  293: 						"/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  294:     {error, bad_directory} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  295: 						     "/kdlk/kernel-1.2"),
  296:     P = code:get_path(), % Check that path is not changed.
  297: 
  298:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  299: 
  300:     %% Replace an existing application.
  301: 
  302:     file:make_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  303:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  304:     NewDir = Cwd ++ "/kernel-2.11",
  305:     true = code:replace_path(kernel, NewDir),
  306:     NewDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  307:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  308:     ok = file:del_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  309: 
  310:     %% Add a completely new application.
  311: 
  312:     NewAppName = 'blurf_blarfer',
  313:     NewAppDir = filename:join(Cwd, atom_to_list(NewAppName) ++ "-6.33.1"),
  314:     ok = file:make_dir(NewAppDir),
  315:     true = code:replace_path(NewAppName, NewAppDir),
  316:     NewAppDir = code:lib_dir(NewAppName),
  317:     NewAppDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  318:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  319:     ok = file:del_dir(NewAppDir),
  320: 
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: code_path_cache(Config) ->
  324:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  325: 
  326:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
  327:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
  328:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  329:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  330: 
  331:     Original = code:get_path(),
  332:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "myebin"),
  333:     filelib:ensure_path(Dir),
  334:     ToBeReplacedDir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-1/ebin"),
  335:     ToBeReplacedDir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-2/ebin"),
  336:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  337:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir2),
  338: 
  339:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?TESTMODOBJ),
  340:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
  341: 
  342:     %% Adding a cached path and re-adding for clearing
  343:     [begin
  344:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  345:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  346:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  347:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  348:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  349:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  350:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  351:         code:del_path(Dir),
  352:         ok = file:delete(File)
  353:      end || Fun <- [add_path, add_patha, add_pathz]],
  354: 
  355:     Original = code:get_path(),
  356: 
  357:     %% Adding several cached paths and explicit cache clearing
  358:     [begin
  359:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  360:         ok = code:Fun([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1], cache),
  361:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  362:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  363:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  364:         ok = code:clear_cache(),
  365:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  366:         ok = code:del_paths([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1]),
  367:         ok = file:delete(File)
  368:      end || Fun <- [add_paths, add_pathsa, add_pathsz]],
  369: 
  370:     Original = code:get_path(),
  371: 
  372:     %% Replacing a non-cached path with cache and set_path for clearing
  373:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  374:     true = code:add_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  375:     true = code:replace_path(tobereplaced, ToBeReplacedDir2, cache),
  376:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  377:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(ToBeReplacedDir2, ?TESTMODOBJ), Bin),
  378:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  379:     true = code:set_path(code:get_path(), nocache),
  380:     {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  381: 
  382:     true = code:set_path(Original),
  383:     ok.
  384: 
  385: %% OTP-3977.
  386: dir_disappeared(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  387:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  388:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "temp"),
  389:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  390:     true = code:add_path(Dir),
  391:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  392:     non_existing = code:which(bubbelskrammel),
  393:     ok.
  394: 
  395: load_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  396:     {error, nofile} = code:load_file(duuuumy_mod),
  397:     {error, badfile} = code:load_file(code_a_test),
  398:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_file(123)),
  399:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  400:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  401:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  402:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  403:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  404:     ok.
  405: 
  406: test_dir() ->
  407:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
  408: 
  409: load_abs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  410:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  411:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/duuuumy_mod"),
  412:     {error, badfile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_a_test"),
  413:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_abs({})),
  414:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs("Non-latin-имя-файла"),
  415:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  416:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  417:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  418:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  419:     ok.
  420: 
  421: ensure_loaded_bad_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  422:     %% Make sure loading an invalid .beam file does
  423:     %% not hold a permanent lock on the server.
  424:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  425:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  426:     ok.
  427: 
  428: ensure_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  429:     {module, lists} = code:ensure_loaded(lists),
  430:     case init:get_argument(mode) of
  431: 	{ok, [["embedded"] | _]} ->
  432: 	    {error, embedded} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  433: 	    {error, badarg} = code:ensure_loaded(34),
  434: 	    ok;
  435: 	_ ->
  436: 	    {error, nofile} = code:ensure_loaded(duuuumy_mod),
  437: 	    {error, badfile} = code:ensure_loaded(code_a_test),
  438: 	    {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:ensure_loaded(34)),
  439: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  440: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  441: 	    ok
  442:     end.
  443: 
  444: ensure_loaded_many(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  445:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  446:         %% Without special handling for async loading in code server,
  447:         %% this operation seemed to consistently take 5s+
  448:         Action = fun() ->
  449:             Self = self(),
  450:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  451:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  452:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  453:             ok
  454:         end,
  455:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []], 1_000)
  456:     end).
  457: 
  458: ensure_loaded_many_kill(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  459:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  460:         Action = fun() ->
  461:             Self = self(),
  462:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  463:             sys:suspend(code_server),
  464:             First = spawn_opt(Fun, [{priority, max}]),
  465:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  466:             sys:resume(code_server),
  467:             exit(First, kill),
  468:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  469:             {file, _} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  470:             ok
  471:         end,
  472:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []])
  473:     end).
  474: 
  475: with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, Fun) ->
  476:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  477:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  478:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun set_up_large_loadpath/1, [Priv]]),
  479:     try Fun(Node)
  480:     after peer:stop(Peer)
  481:     end.
  482: 
  483: set_up_large_loadpath(Priv) ->
  484:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  485:     Dirs = [filename:join(Priv, integer_to_list(N)) || N <- lists:seq(1, 500)],
  486:     [ok = filelib:ensure_path(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  487:     [true = code:add_patha(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  488:     ok.
  489: 
  490: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  491:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  492:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  493:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  494:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  495:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:delete(122)),
  496:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  497:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  498:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  499:     exit(Pid,kill),
  500:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  501:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  502:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  503:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  504:     ok.
  505: 
  506: purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  507:     run_purge_test(fun purge_test/1, Config).
  508: 
  509: purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  510:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  511:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  512:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  513:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  514:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  515:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  516:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  517:     true = code:purge(code_b_test),
  518:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  519:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  520:     ok.
  521: 
  522: purge_many_exits() ->
  523:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
  524: 
  525: purge_many_exits(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  526:     run_purge_test(fun purge_many_exits_test/1, Config).
  527: 
  528: purge_many_exits_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  529:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  530: 
  531:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  532:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  533: 
  534:     CodePurgeF = fun(M, Exp) -> Exp = code:purge(M) end,
  535:     purge_many_exits_do(CodePurgeF),
  536: 
  537:     %% Let's repeat test for erlang:purge_module as it does the same thing
  538:     %% now in erts-8.0 (except for return value).
  539:     ErlangPurgeF = fun(M, _Exp) -> erlang:purge_module(M) end,
  540:     purge_many_exits_do(ErlangPurgeF),
  541: 
  542:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  543:     ok.
  544: 
  545: 
  546: purge_many_exits_do(PurgeF) ->
  547:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  548:     TPids = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  549: 			      {code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  550: 			       spawn_link(fun () ->
  551: 						  receive
  552: 						  after infinity -> ok
  553: 						  end
  554: 					  end)}
  555: 			 end,
  556: 			 lists:seq(1, 1000)),
  557:     %% Give them time to start...
  558:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  559:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  560:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  561: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  562: 			  false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  563: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2)
  564: 		  end, TPids),
  565:     PurgeF(code_b_test, true),
  566:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  567: 			  false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  568: 			  true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  569: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2),
  570: 			  exit(Pid2, kill)
  571: 		  end, TPids),
  572:     lists:foreach(fun ({_Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  573: 			  receive {'EXIT', Pid2, _} -> ok end
  574: 		  end, TPids).
  575: 
  576: 
  577: soft_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  578:     run_purge_test(fun soft_purge_test/1, Config).
  579: 
  580: soft_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  581:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  582:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  583:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:soft_purge(23)),
  584:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  585:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  586:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  587:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  588:     false = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  589:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  590:     exit(Pid,kill),
  591:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  592:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  593:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  594:     ok.
  595: 
  596: is_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  597:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  598:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  599:     false = code:is_loaded(duuuuuumy_mod),
  600:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:is_loaded(23)),
  601:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(init),
  602:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  603:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  604:     {file, _Loaded} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  605:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  606:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  607:     ok.
  608: 
  609: all_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  610:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  611: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  612: 	false -> all_loaded_1()
  613:     end.
  614: 
  615: all_loaded_1() ->
  616:     Preloaded = [{M,preloaded} || M <- lists:sort(erlang:pre_loaded())],
  617: 
  618:     Loaded0 = lists:sort(code:all_loaded()),
  619:     all_unique(Loaded0),
  620:     Loaded1 = lists:keysort(2, Loaded0),
  621:     Loaded2 = match_and_remove(Preloaded, Loaded1),
  622: 
  623:     ObjExt = code:objfile_extension(),
  624:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  625: 	    ({Mod,AbsName}) when is_atom(Mod), is_list(AbsName) ->
  626: 		Mod =/= list_to_atom(filename:basename(AbsName, ObjExt));
  627: 	    (_) -> true
  628: 	end, Loaded2),
  629:     ok.
  630: 
  631: match_and_remove([], List) -> List;
  632: match_and_remove([X|T1], [X|T2]) -> match_and_remove(T1, T2).
  633: 
  634: all_unique([]) -> ok;
  635: all_unique([_]) -> ok;
  636: all_unique([{X,_}|[{Y,_}|_]=T]) when X < Y -> all_unique(T).
  637: 
  638: all_available(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  639:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  640: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  641: 	false -> all_available_1(Config)
  642:     end.
  643: 
  644: all_available_1(Config) ->
  645: 
  646:     %% Add an ez dir to make sure the modules in there are found
  647:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  648:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  649: 
  650:     Available = code:all_available(),
  651: 
  652:     %% Test that baz and blarg that are part of the .ez archive are found
  653:     {value, _} =
  654:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "baz" end, Available),
  655:     {value, _} =
  656:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "blarg" end, Available),
  657: 
  658:     %% Test that all loaded are part of all available
  659:     Loaded = [{atom_to_list(M),P,true} || {M,P} <- code:all_loaded()],
  660:     [] = Loaded -- Available,
  661: 
  662:     {value, {ModStr,_,false} = NotLoaded} =
  663:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not is_atom(Name) end, Available),
  664:     ct:log("Testing with ~p",[NotLoaded]),
  665: 
  666:     Mod = list_to_atom(ModStr),
  667: 
  668:     %% Test that the module is actually not loaded
  669:     false = code:is_loaded(Mod),
  670: 
  671:     %% Load it
  672:     Mod:module_info(),
  673: 
  674:     {value, {ModStr,_,true}} =
  675:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,_}) -> Name =:= ModStr end, code:all_available()),
  676: 
  677:     ok.
  678: 
  679: load_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  680:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  681:     File = TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  682:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  683:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(12, File, Bin)),
  684:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, 12, Bin)),
  685:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, 12)),
  686:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  687:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  688:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  689:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  690:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  691:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  692:     ok.
  693: 
  694: 
  695: upgrade() ->
  696:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
  697: 
  698: upgrade(Config) ->
  699:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  700:     upgrade_do(DataDir, beam, [beam]),
  701:     ok.
  702: 
  703: upgrade_do(DataDir, Client, T) ->
  704:     compile_load(upgrade_client, DataDir, undefined, Client),
  705:     [upgrade_client:run(DataDir, U1, U2, O1, O2)
  706:      || U1<-T, U2<-T, O1<-T, O2<-T],
  707:     ok.
  708: 
  709: compile_load(Mod, Dir, Ver, CodeType) ->
  710:     %%erlang:display({"{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{Loading",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  711:     Version = case Ver of
  712: 	undefined ->
  713: 	    io:format("Compiling '~p' as ~p\n", [Mod, CodeType]),
  714: 	    [];
  715: 	_ ->
  716: 	    io:format("Compiling version ~p of '~p' as ~p\n",
  717: 		[Ver, Mod, CodeType]),
  718: 	    [{d,list_to_atom("VERSION_" ++ integer_to_list(Ver))}]
  719:     end,
  720: 
  721:     CompOpts = [binary, report] ++ Version,
  722: 
  723:     Src = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  724:     T1 = erlang:now(),
  725:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(Src, CompOpts),
  726:     T2 = erlang:now(),
  727:     ObjFile = filename:basename(Src,".erl") ++ ".beam",
  728:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
  729:     T3 = erlang:now(),
  730:     io:format("Compile time ~p ms, Load time ~p ms\n",
  731: 	      [timer:now_diff(T2,T1) div 1000, timer:now_diff(T3,T2) div 1000]),
  732:     %%erlang:display({"}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}Loaded",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  733:     ok.
  734: 
  735: dir_req(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  736:     {ok,[[Root0]]} = init:get_argument(root),
  737:     Root = filename:join([Root0]),	% Normalised form.
  738:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  739:     LibDir = Root ++ "/lib",
  740:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  741:     code:compiler_dir(),
  742:     {error, bad_name} = code:lib_dir(duuumy),
  743:     KernLib = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  744:     Priv = KernLib ++ "/priv",
  745:     Priv = code:priv_dir(kernel),
  746:     {error, bad_name} = code:priv_dir(duuumy),
  747:     ok.
  748: 
  749: object_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  750:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  751:     P = code:get_path(),
  752:     P = code:get_path(),
  753:     code:add_path(TestDir),
  754:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  755:     LoadedFile = filename:absname(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++
  756: 				  code:objfile_extension()),
  757:     case code:get_object_code(code_b_test) of
  758: 	      {code_b_test,Bin,LoadedFile} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  759: 		  ok
  760: 	  end,
  761:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  762:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  763:     error = code:get_object_code(dddddddduuuuuuumy),
  764:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:get_object_code(23)),
  765:     code:set_path(P),
  766:     P=code:get_path(),
  767:     ok.
  768: 
  769: %% Test that set_path does not accept
  770: %% files as pathnames (known previous bug)
  771: set_path_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  772:     File=filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "testfil"),
  773:     ok=file:write_file(File, list_to_binary("lite data")),
  774:     {error, bad_directory}=code:set_path([File]).
  775: 
  776: %% Test that a module with the same name as a module in
  777: %% a sticky directory cannot be loaded.
  778: sticky_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  779:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  780:     Mods = [code,lists,erlang,init],
  781:     OutDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), sticky_dir),
  782:     _ = file:make_dir(OutDir),
  783:     Ret = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply,
  784: 		   [fun sticky_compiler/2,[Mods,OutDir]]),
  785:     case Ret of
  786: 	[] ->
  787: 	    ok;
  788: 	Other ->
  789: 	    io:format("~p\n", [Other]),
  790: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  791:     end,
  792:     peer:stop(Peer),
  793:     ok.
  794: 
  795: sticky_compiler(Files, PrivDir) ->
  796:     code:add_patha(PrivDir),
  797:     Rets = [do_sticky_compile(F, PrivDir) || F <- Files],
  798:     [R || R <- Rets, R =/= ok].
  799: 
  800: do_sticky_compile(Mod, Dir) ->
  801:     case code:is_sticky(Mod) of
  802:         true ->
  803:             %% Make sure that the module is loaded. A module being sticky
  804:             %% only prevents it from begin reloaded, not from being loaded
  805:             %% from the wrong place to begin with.
  806:             Mod = Mod:module_info(module),
  807:             File = filename:append(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod)),
  808:             Src = io_lib:format("-module(~s).\n"
  809:                                 "-export([test/1]).\n"
  810:                                 "test(me) -> fail.\n", [Mod]),
  811:             ok = file:write_file(File++".erl", Src),
  812:             case c:c(File, [{outdir,Dir}]) of
  813:                 {ok,Module} ->
  814:                     Module:test(me);
  815:                 {error,sticky_directory} ->
  816:                     ok
  817:             end;
  818:         false ->
  819:             %% For some reason the module is not sticky
  820:             %% could be that the .erlang file has
  821:             %% unstuck it?
  822:             {Mod, is_not_sticky}
  823:     end.
  824: 
  825: %% Test that the -pa and -pz options work as expected.
  826: pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  827:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  828:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"pa"),
  829:     PzDir = filename:join(DDir,"pz"),
  830:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  831:     Ret=rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
  832:     [PaDir|Paths] = Ret,
  833:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths),
  834:     peer:stop(Peer),
  835:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-pa",
  836:         PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  837:     Ret2=rpc:call(Node2, code, get_path, []),
  838:     [PaDir|Paths2] = Ret2,
  839:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths2),
  840:     peer:stop(Peer2).
  841: 
  842: %% add_path, del_path should not cause priv_dir(App) to fail.
  843: add_del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  844:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  845:     Dir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/ebin"),
  846:     Dir2 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-2.0/ebin"),
  847:     code:add_patha(Dir1),
  848:     PrivDir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/priv"),
  849:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  850:     code:add_path(Dir2), % put last in path
  851:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  852:     code:del_path(Dir2),
  853:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  854:     ok.
  855: 
  856: 
  857: clash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  858:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  859:     P = code:get_path(),
  860: 
  861:     %% test non-clashing entries
  862: 
  863:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  864:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"zork-0.8/ebin"),
  865:     ct:capture_start(),
  866:     ok = code:clash(),
  867:     ct:capture_stop(),
  868:     [OKMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  869:     true = lists:prefix("** Found 0 name clashes", OKMsg),
  870:     true = code:set_path(P),
  871: 
  872:     %% test clashing entries
  873: 
  874:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  875:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  876:     ct:capture_start(),
  877:     ok = code:clash(),
  878:     ct:capture_stop(),
  879:     [ClashMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  880:     {match, [" hides "]} = re:run(ClashMsg, "\\*\\* .*( hides ).*",
  881: 					[{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  882:     true = code:set_path(P),
  883: 
  884:     %% test "Bad path can't read"
  885: 
  886:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  887:     TmpEzFile = Priv++"foobar-0.tmp.ez",
  888:     {ok, _} = file:copy(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez", TmpEzFile),
  889:     true = code:add_path(TmpEzFile++"/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  890:     case os:type() of
  891:         {win32,_} ->
  892: 	    %% The file won't be deleted on windows until it's closed, why we
  893: 	    %% need to rename instead.
  894: 	    ok = file:rename(TmpEzFile,TmpEzFile++".moved");
  895: 	 _ ->
  896:     	    ok = file:delete(TmpEzFile)
  897:     end,
  898:     ct:capture_start(),
  899:     ok = code:clash(),
  900:     ct:capture_stop(),
  901:     [BadPathMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  902:     true = lists:prefix("** Bad path can't read", BadPathMsg),
  903:     true = code:set_path(P),
  904:     file:delete(TmpEzFile++".moved"), %% Only effect on windows
  905:     ok.
  906: 
  907: %% Every module that the code_server uses should be preloaded,
  908: %% this test case verifies that.
  909: ext_mod_dep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  910:     xref:start(s),
  911:     xref:set_default(s, [{verbose,false},{warnings,false},
  912: 			 {builtins,true},{recurse,true}]),
  913:     xref:set_library_path(s, code:get_path()),
  914:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin")),
  915:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib),"ebin")),
  916:     case catch ext_mod_dep2() of
  917: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  918: 	    xref:stop(s),
  919: 	    exit(Reason);
  920: 	Else ->
  921:     	    xref:stop(s),
  922: 	    case Else of
  923: 		ok -> ok;
  924: 		_ -> ct:fail(Else)
  925: 	    end
  926:     end.
  927: 
  928: ext_mod_dep2() ->
  929:     Exports0 = code_server:module_info(exports) --
  930: 	[{module_info,0},{module_info,1}],
  931:     Exports = [{code_server,M,A} || {M,A} <- Exports0],
  932:     case analyse(Exports, [], [], 0) of
  933: 	{_Visited,0} ->
  934: 	    ok;
  935: 	{_Visited,ErrCnt} ->
  936: 	    {not_verified,ErrCnt}
  937:     end.
  938: 
  939: analyse([], [], Visited, ErrCnt) ->
  940:     {Visited,ErrCnt};
  941: analyse([], [This={M,F,A}|Path], Visited, ErrCnt0) ->
  942:     %% The code_server has been granted to use the following modules,
  943:     %% These modules should be loaded by code.erl before
  944:     %% the code_server is started.
  945:     OK = [erlang, os, prim_file, erl_prim_loader, init, ets,
  946: 	  code_server, lists, lists_sort, unicode, binary, filename,
  947: 	  gb_sets, gb_trees, erts_code_purger, erts_internal, code,
  948: 	  prim_zip, zlib],
  949:     ErrCnt1 =
  950: 	case lists:member(M, OK) or erlang:is_builtin(M,F,A) of
  951: 	    true ->
  952: 		0;
  953: 	    false ->
  954: 		check_funs(This, Path)
  955: 	end,
  956:     {Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0};
  957: analyse([MFA|R], Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0) ->
  958:     case lists:member(MFA,Visited0) of
  959: 	false ->
  960: 	    {Visited,ErrCnt1} = analyse2(MFA, Path, Visited0),
  961: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0);
  962: 	true ->
  963: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0)
  964:     end.
  965: 
  966: analyse2(MFA = {'$M_EXPR',_, _}, Path, Visited0) ->
  967:     analyse([], [MFA|Path], Visited0, 0);
  968: analyse2(MFA={_,_,_}, Path, Visited0) ->
  969:     {ok, FL} = xref:analyze(s,{call,MFA}),
  970:     analyse(FL, [MFA|Path], my_usort([MFA|Visited0]), 0).
  971: 
  972: %%%% We need to check these manually...
  973: %% fun's are ok as long as they are defined locally.
  974: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  975: 	   [{unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  976: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  977: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  978: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},

  981: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  982: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;

  987: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  988: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  989: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  990: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  991: 	   [{code_server,do_mod_call,4},
  992: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3}|_]) -> 0;
  993: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  994: 	   [{lists,flatmap_1,2},
  995: 	    {lists,flatmap,2},
  996: 	    {lists,concat,1},
  997: 	    {code_server,load_abs,4},
  998: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
  999: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1000: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1001: 	   [{lists,foreach_1,2},
 1002: 	    {lists,foreach,2},
 1003: 	    {code_server,stick_dir,3},
 1004: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
 1005: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1006: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1007: 	   [{lists,all,2},
 1008: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1009: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1010: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1011: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},
 1012: 	    {code_server,choose_bundles,1},
 1013: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
 1014: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1015: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
 1016: 	    {code_server,init,3},
 1017: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;

 1019: 	   [{lists,all_1,2},
 1020: 	    {lists,all,2},
 1021: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1022: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1023: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1024: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},

 1027: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1028: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},

 1030: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
