 1038: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1039: 	   [{erlang,spawn_link,1},{code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1040: check_funs({'$M_EXPR',warning_msg,2},
 1041: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_report,2} | _]) -> 0;
 1042: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1043: 	   [{code_server,run,2}|_]) -> 0;
 1044: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1045: 	   [{code_server,handle_on_load,5}|_]) -> 0;
 1046: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1047: 	   [{code_server,handle_pending_on_load,4}|_]) -> 0;
 1048: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1049: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_2,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1050: check_funs(This, Path) ->
 1051:     io:format("not_verified(~p, ~p)~n", [This, Path]),
 1052:     1.
 1053: 
 1054: my_usort(List) ->
 1055:     lists:reverse(uniq(lists:sort(List),[])).
 1056: 
 1057: uniq([],A) ->
 1058:     A;
 1059: uniq([H|T],[]) ->
 1060:     uniq(T,[H]);
 1061: uniq([H|T],[H|_]=A) ->
 1062:     uniq(T,A);
 1063: uniq([H|T],A) ->
 1064:     uniq(T,[H|A]).
 1065: 
 1066: 
 1067: where_is_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1068:     {T,KernelBeamFile} = timer:tc(code, where_is_file, ["kernel.beam"]),
 1069:     io:format("Load time: ~w ms~n", [T]),
 1070:     KernelEbinDir = filename:dirname(KernelBeamFile),
 1071:     AppFile = filename:join(KernelEbinDir, "kernel.app"),
 1072:     AppFile = code:where_is_file("kernel.app"),
 1073:     non_existing = code:where_is_file("kernel"), % no such file
 1074:     ok.
 1075: 
 1076: %% Test that stacktrace is deleted when purging a referred module.
 1077: purge_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1078:     run_purge_test(fun purge_stacktrace_test/1, Config).
 1079:     
 1080: purge_stacktrace_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1081:     code:purge(code_b_test),
 1082:     try code_b_test:call(fun(b) -> ok end, a)
 1083:     catch
 1084: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace ->
 1085: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1086: 	    case Stacktrace of
 1087: 		      [{?MODULE,_,[a],_},
 1088: 		       {code_b_test,call,2,_},
 1089: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1090: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1091: 		  end
 1092:     end,
 1093:     try code_b_test:call(nofun, 2)
 1094:     catch
 1095: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace2 ->
 1096: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1097: 	    case Stacktrace2 of
 1098: 		      [{code_b_test,call,[nofun,2],_},
 1099: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1100: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1101: 		  end
 1102:     end,
 1103:     Args = [erlang,error,[badarg]],
 1104:     try code_b_test:call(erlang, error, [badarg,Args])
 1105:     catch
 1106: 	error:badarg:Stacktrace3 ->
 1107: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1108: 	    case Stacktrace3 of
 1109: 		      [{code_b_test,call,Args,_},
 1110: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1111: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1112: 		  end
 1113:     end,
 1114:     ok.
 1115: 
 1116: mult_lib_roots(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1117:     DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mult_lib_roots"),
 1118:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-b/ebin/lists"),
 1119: 
 1120:     %% We will use this module to test both code path loading and
 1121:     %% code path caching. So we ensure its beam file does not exist.
 1122:     CodeSuiteMultRootBeam =
 1123: 	filename:join(DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1124:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1125: 
 1126:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1127:     ErlLibs = filename:join(DataDir, "first_root") ++ mult_lib_sep() ++
 1128: 	filename:join(DataDir, "second_root"),
 1129: 
 1130:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs]),
 1131: 
 1132:     Path0 = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1133:     %% ?CT_PEER adds extra path to this module folder
 1134:     PathToSelf = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1135:     [PathToSelf, "."|Path1] = Path0,
 1136:     [Kernel|Path2] = Path1,
 1137:     [Stdlib|Path3] = Path2,
 1138:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Kernel, "kernel"),
 1139:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Stdlib, "stdlib"),
 1140:     [Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5|Path] = Path3,
 1141: 
 1142: 
 1143:     ["first_root/my_dummy_app-a/ebin",
 1144:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-b/ebin",
 1145:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin",
 1146:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-d/ebin",
 1147:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-e/ebin"] =
 1148: 	[mult_lib_remove_prefix(E, DataDir) ||
 1149: 	    E <- lists:sort([Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5])],
 1150:     io:format("~p\n", [Path]),
 1151: 
 1152:     %% Now let's attempt to dynamically add a module,
 1153:     %% this will fail due to the boot paths cache.
 1154:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1155:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1156:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1157:     %% Test that the CWD is not cached
 1158:     File = filename:join([DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"]),
 1159:     {ok, _} = compile:file(File, [{outdir, "."}]),
 1160:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1161:     true = rpc:call(Node, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1162:     file:delete("code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1163:     %% Clean up so we can start again
 1164:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1165:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1166: 
 1167:     NoCacheArgs = ["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs, "-cache_boot_paths", "false"],
 1168:     {ok, NoCachePeer, NoCacheNode} = ?CT_PEER(NoCacheArgs),
 1169: 
 1170:     %% Now the same code should work
 1171:     error = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1172:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1173:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1174:     true = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1175: 
 1176:     peer:stop(NoCachePeer),
 1177:     ok.
 1178: 
 1179: mult_lib_compile(Root, Last) ->
 1180:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(Last)),
 1181:     Name = filename:join([Root,"first_root",Last]),
 1182:     Dir = filename:dirname(Name),
 1183:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Name, [report,{outdir,Dir}]),
 1184:     ok.
 1185: 
 1186: mult_lib_sep() ->
 1187:     case os:type() of
 1188: 	{win32,_} -> ";";
 1189: 	_ -> ":"
 1190:     end.
 1191: 
 1192: mult_lib_verify_lib(Path, Expected) ->
 1193:     Dir = filename:basename(filename:dirname(Path)),
 1194:     true = lists:prefix(Expected, Dir).
 1195: 
 1196: mult_lib_remove_prefix([H|T1], [H|T2]) ->
 1197:     mult_lib_remove_prefix(T1, T2);
 1198: mult_lib_remove_prefix([$/|T], []) -> T.
 1199: 
 1200: bad_erl_libs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1201:     %% Preserve ERL_LIBS if set.
 1202:     BadLibs0 = "/no/such/dir",
 1203:     BadLibs =
 1204:          case os:getenv("ERL_LIBS") of
 1205:              false -> BadLibs0;
 1206:              Libs -> BadLibs0 ++ ":" ++ Libs
 1207:          end,
 1208:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1209:     Code = rpc:call(Node,code,get_path,[]),
 1210:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1211: 
 1212:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", BadLibs]),
 1213:     Code2 = rpc:call(Node2,code,get_path,[]),
 1214:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1215:     %% Test that code path is not affected by the faulty ERL_LIBS
 1216:     Code = Code2,
 1217: 
 1218:     ok.
 1219: 
 1220: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1221: 
 1222: %% Create an archive file containing an application and make use of it.
 1223: 
 1224: code_archive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1225:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs", false).
 1226: 
 1227: code_archive2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1228:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs2", true).
 1229: 
 1230: do_code_archive(Config, Root, StripVsn) when is_list(Config) ->
 1231:     %% Copy the orig files to priv_dir
 1232:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1233:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1234:     App = code_archive_dict,
 1235:     VsnBase = atom_to_list(App) ++ "-1.0",
 1236:     Base =
 1237: 	case StripVsn of
 1238: 	    true  -> atom_to_list(App);
 1239: 	    false -> VsnBase
 1240: 	end,
 1241:     Ext = init:archive_extension(),
 1242:     RootDir = filename:join([PrivDir, Root]),
 1243:     ok = file:make_dir(RootDir),
 1244:     Archive = filename:join([RootDir, VsnBase ++ Ext]),
 1245:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [VsnBase],
 1246: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, DataDir}]),
 1247:     {ok, _} = zip:extract(Archive, [{cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1248: 
 1249:     case StripVsn of
 1250: 	true ->
 1251: 	    ok = file:rename(filename:join([PrivDir, VsnBase]),
 1252: 				   filename:join([PrivDir, Base]));
 1253: 	false ->
 1254: 	    ok
 1255:     end,
 1256: 
 1257:     io:format("DEBUG: ~p\n", [?LINE]),
 1258:     %% Compile the code
 1259:     ok = compile_app(PrivDir, Base),
 1260: 
 1261:     %% Create the archive
 1262:     ok = file:delete(Archive),
 1263:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [Base],
 1264: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1265: 
 1266:     %% Create a directory and a file outside of the archive.
 1267:     OtherFile = filename:join([RootDir,VsnBase,"other","other.txt"]),
 1268:     OtherContents = ?MODULE:module_info(md5),
 1269:     filelib:ensure_dir(OtherFile),
 1270:     ok = file:write_file(OtherFile, OtherContents),
 1271: 
 1272:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1273:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", RootDir]),
 1274:     CodePath = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1275:     AppEbin = filename:join([Archive, Base, "ebin"]),
 1276:     io:format("AppEbin: ~p\n", [AppEbin]),
 1277:     io:format("CodePath: ~p\n", [CodePath]),
 1278:     io:format("Archive: ~p\n", [erl_prim_loader:read_file_info(Archive)]),
 1279:     true = lists:member(AppEbin, CodePath),
 1280: 
 1281:     %% Start the app
 1282:     ok = rpc:call(Node, application, start, [App]),
 1283: 
 1284:     %% Get the lib dir for the app.
 1285:     AppLibDir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App]),
 1286:     io:format("AppLibDir: ~p\n", [AppLibDir]),
 1287:     AppLibDir = filename:join(RootDir, VsnBase),
 1288: 
 1289:     %% Access the app priv dir
 1290:     AppPrivDir = rpc:call(Node, code, priv_dir, [App]),
 1291:     AppPrivFile = filename:join([AppPrivDir, "code_archive.txt"]),
 1292:     io:format("AppPrivFile: ~p\n", [AppPrivFile]),
 1293:     {ok, _Bin, _} =
 1294: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [AppPrivFile]),
 1295: 
 1296:     %% Read back the other text file.
 1297:     OtherDirPath = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App,other]),
 1298:     OtherFilePath = filename:join(OtherDirPath, "other.txt"),
 1299:     io:format("OtherFilePath: ~p\n", [OtherFilePath]),
 1300:     {ok, OtherContents, _} =
 1301: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [OtherFilePath]),
 1302: 
 1303:     %% Use the app
 1304:     Tab = code_archive_tab,
 1305:     Key = foo,
 1306:     Val = bar,
 1307:     {ok, _Pid} =  rpc:call(Node, App, new, [Tab]),
 1308:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1309:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, store, [Tab, Key, Val]),
 1310:     {ok, Val} =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1311:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab, Key]),
 1312:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1313:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab]),
 1314: 
 1315:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1316:     ok.
 1317: 
 1318: compile_app(TopDir, AppName) ->
 1319:     AppDir = filename:join([TopDir, AppName]),
 1320:     SrcDir = filename:join([AppDir, "src"]),
 1321:     OutDir = filename:join([AppDir, "ebin"]),
 1322:     {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(SrcDir),
 1323:     compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir).
 1324: 
 1325: compile_files([File | Files], SrcDir, OutDir) ->
 1326:     case filename:extension(File) of
 1327: 	".erl" ->
 1328: 	    AbsFile = filename:join([SrcDir, File]),
 1329: 	    case compile:file(AbsFile, [{outdir, OutDir}]) of
 1330: 		{ok, _Mod} ->
 1331: 		    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir);
 1332: 		Error ->
 1333: 		    {compilation_error, AbsFile, OutDir, Error}
 1334: 	    end;
 1335: 	_ ->
 1336: 	    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir)
 1337:     end;
 1338: compile_files([], _, _) ->
 1339:     ok.
 1340: 
 1341: %% Test that a boot file with (almost) all of OTP can be used to start an
 1342: %% embeddedd system.
 1343: big_boot_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1344:     {BootArg,AppsInBoot} = create_big_boot(Config),
 1345:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootArg, "-mode", "embedded"]),
 1346:     RemoteNodeApps =
 1347: 	[ {X,Y} || {X,_,Y} <-
 1348: 		       rpc:call(Node,application,loaded_applications,[]) ],
 1349:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1350:     true = lists:sort(AppsInBoot) =:=  lists:sort(RemoteNodeApps),
 1351:     ok.
 1352: 
 1353: on_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1354:     Master = on_load_test_case_process,
 1355: 
 1356:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load"]),
 1357:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1358:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1359: 
 1360:     %% Register a name for this process.
 1361:     register(Master, self()),
 1362: 
 1363:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1364: 					  exit(on_load_a:data())
 1365: 				  end),
 1366:     receive
 1367: 	{on_load_a,start} -> ok
 1368:     end,
 1369:     receive
 1370: 	{on_load_b,start} -> ok
 1371:     end,
 1372:     receive
 1373: 	{on_load_c,PidC} -> ok
 1374:     end,
 1375: 
 1376:     Refs = on_load_massive_spawn(lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1377:     receive after 7 -> ok end,
 1378: 
 1379:     PidC ! go,
 1380: 
 1381:     KernelLibDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
 1382:     receive
 1383: 	{on_load_c,done} -> ok
 1384:     end,
 1385:     receive
 1386: 	{on_load_b,done} -> ok
 1387:     end,
 1388:     receive
 1389: 	{on_load_a,KernelLibDir} -> ok
 1390:     end,
 1391: 
 1392:     receive
 1393: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Res} ->
 1394: 	    [a,b,c] = Res
 1395:     end,
 1396: 
 1397:     on_load_wait_for_all(Refs),
 1398:     receive
 1399: 	Any ->
 1400: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
 1401:     after 10 ->
 1402: 	    ok
 1403:     end.
 1404: 
 1405: on_load_massive_spawn([_|T]) ->
 1406:     {_,Ra} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [a,b,c] = on_load_a:data() end),
 1407:     {_,Rb} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [b,c] = on_load_b:data() end),
 1408:     {_,Rc} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [c] = on_load_c:data() end),
 1409:     [Ra,Rb,Rc|on_load_massive_spawn(T)];
 1410: on_load_massive_spawn([]) -> [].
 1411: 
 1412: on_load_wait_for_all([Ref|T]) ->
 1413:     receive
 1414: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,normal} ->
 1415: 	    on_load_wait_for_all(T)
 1416:     end;
 1417: on_load_wait_for_all([]) -> ok.
 1418: 
 1419: on_load_binary(_) ->
 1420:     Master = on_load_binary_test_case_process,
 1421:     register(Master, self()),
 1422: 
 1423:     %% Construct, compile and pretty-print.
 1424:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1425:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1426:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1427: 	       "-export([ok/0]).\n",
 1428: 	       "-on_load({init,0}).\n",
 1429: 	       "init() ->\n",
 1430: 	       "  '@Master@' ! {on_load_binary,self()},\n",
 1431: 	       "  receive go -> ok end.\n",
 1432: 	       "ok() -> true.\n"]),
 1433:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1434:     merl:print(Tree),
 1435: 
 1436:     {Pid1,Ref1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1437: 					code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1438: 					true = on_load_binary:ok()
 1439: 				end),
 1440:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid} -> ok end,
 1441:     {Pid2,Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1442: 					true = on_load_binary:ok()
 1443: 				end),
 1444:     erlang:yield(),
 1445:     OnLoadPid ! go,
 1446:     receive {'DOWN',Ref1,process,Pid1,Exit1} -> ok end,
 1447:     receive {'DOWN',Ref2,process,Pid2,Exit2} -> ok end,
 1448:     normal = Exit1,
 1449:     normal = Exit2,
 1450:     true = code:delete(on_load_binary),
 1451:     false = code:purge(on_load_binary),
 1452:     ok.
 1453: 
 1454: on_load_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1455:     try
 1456: 	on_load_embedded_1(Config)
 1457:     catch
 1458: 	throw:{skip,_}=Skip ->
 1459: 	    Skip
 1460:     end.
 1461: 
 1462: on_load_embedded_1(Config) ->
 1463:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1464:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
 1465: 
 1466:     %% Link the on_load_app application into the lib directory.
 1467:     OnLoadApp = filename:join(DataDir, "on_load_app-1.0"),
 1468:     del_link(LinkName),
 1469:     io:format("LinkName :~p, OnLoadApp: ~p~n",[LinkName,OnLoadApp]),
 1470:     case file:make_symlink(OnLoadApp, LinkName) of
 1471: 	{error,enotsup} ->
 1472: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1473: 	{error,eperm} ->
 1474: 	    %% On Windows, we may not have permissions to create symlinks.
 1475: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1476: 	ok -> ok
 1477:     end,
 1478: 
 1479:     %% Compile the code.
 1480:     OnLoadAppEbin = filename:join(LinkName, "ebin"),
 1481:     {ok,_ } = compile:file(filename:join([OnLoadApp,"src",
 1482: 						"on_load_embedded"]),
 1483: 				 [{outdir,OnLoadAppEbin}]),
 1484: 
 1485:     %% Create and compile a boot file.
 1486:     true = code:add_pathz(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1487:     Options = case is_source_dir() of
 1488: 		  true -> [local];
 1489: 		  false -> []
 1490: 	      end,
 1491:     BootScript = create_boot(Config, Options),
 1492:     true = code:del_path(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1493: 
 1494:     %% Start the node and check that the on_load function was run.
 1495:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-boot", BootScript]),
 1496:     ok = rpc:call(Node, on_load_embedded, status, []),
 1497: 
 1498:     %% Clean up.
 1499:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1500: 
 1501: del_link(LinkName) ->
 1502:    case file:delete(LinkName) of
 1503:        {error,eperm} ->
 1504:              file:del_dir(LinkName);
 1505:        Other ->
 1506:        	     Other
 1507:    end.
 1508: 
 1509: create_boot(Config, Options) ->
 1510:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1511:     {LatestDir,LatestName} = create_script(Config),
 1512:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1513:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1514:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1515:     filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName).
 1516: 
 1517: create_script(Config) ->
 1518:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1519:     Name = PrivDir ++ "on_load_test",
 1520:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 1521:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel, 1, Apps),
 1522:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib, 1, Apps),
 1523:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1524:     io:format(Fd,
 1525: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1526: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1527: 		    " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"},"
 1528: 		    " {on_load_app, \"1.0\"}]}.\n",
 1529: 		    [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
 1530:     file:close(Fd),
 1531:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name)}.
 1532: 
 1533: create_big_boot(Config) ->
 1534:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1535:     {Options,Local} = case is_source_dir() of
 1536: 				true -> {[no_module_tests,local],true};
 1537: 				_ -> {[no_module_tests],false}
 1538: 			    end,
 1539:     {LatestDir,LatestName,Apps} = create_big_script(Config,Local),
 1540:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1541:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1542:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1543:     {filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName),Apps}.
 1544: 
 1545: %% The following apps cannot be loaded.
 1546: 
 1547: %% Orber requires explicit configuration
 1548: filter_app("orber",_) -> false;
 1549: 
 1550: %% cos* depends on orber
 1551: filter_app("cos"++_,_) -> false;
 1552: 
 1553: %% ic has a mod instruction in the app file but no corresponding start
 1554: %% function
 1555: filter_app("ic",_) -> false;
 1556: 
 1557: %% Netconf has some dependency that I really do not understand (maybe
 1558: %% like orber)
 1559: filter_app("netconf",_) -> false;
 1560: 
 1561: %% Safe has the same kind of error in the .app file as ic
 1562: filter_app("safe",_) -> false;
 1563: 
 1564: %% Comte cannot be started in the "usual" way
 1565: filter_app("comte",_) -> false;
 1566: 
 1567: %% OS_mon does not find its port program when running cerl
 1568: filter_app("os_mon",true) -> false;
 1569: 
 1570: %% erts is not a "real" app either =/
 1571: filter_app("erts",_) -> false;
 1572: 
 1573: %% wx* depends on that wxwidgets libs
 1574: filter_app("wx"++_,_) -> false;
 1575: 
 1576: %% Other apps should be OK.
 1577: filter_app(_,_) -> true.
 1578: 
 1579: create_big_script(Config,Local) ->
 1580:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1581:     Name = filename:join(PrivDir,"full_script_test"),
 1582:     InitialApplications=application:loaded_applications(),
 1583:     %% Applications left loaded by the application suite, unload them!
 1584:     UnloadFix=[app0,app1,app2,group_leader,app_start_error],
 1585:     [application:unload(Leftover) ||
 1586: 	      Leftover <- UnloadFix,
 1587: 	      lists:keymember(Leftover,1,InitialApplications) ],
 1588:     %% Now we should have only "real" applications...
 1589:     [application:load(list_to_atom(Y))
 1590: 	|| {match,[Y]} <- [re:run(X,code:lib_dir()++"/"++"([^/-]*).*/ebin",
 1591: 		[{capture,[1],list},unicode]) ||
 1592: 	    X <- code:get_path()],filter_app(Y,Local)],
 1593:     Apps = [ {N,V} || {N,_,V} <- application:loaded_applications()],
 1594:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1595:     io:format(Fd,
 1596: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1597: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1598: 		    " ~p}.\n",
 1599: 		    [Apps]),
 1600:     file:close(Fd),
 1601:     NewlyLoaded =
 1602: 	application:loaded_applications() -- InitialApplications,
 1603:     [ application:unload(N) || {N,_,_} <- NewlyLoaded],
 1604:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name),Apps}.
 1605: 
 1606: is_source_dir() ->
 1607:     filename:basename(code:lib_dir(kernel)) =:= "kernel" andalso
 1608: 	filename:basename(code:lib_dir(stdlib)) =:= "stdlib".
 1609: 
 1610: on_load_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1611:     Master = on_load_error_test_case_process,
 1612:     register(Master, self()),
 1613: 
 1614:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load_errors"]),
 1615:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1616:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1617: 
 1618:     do_on_load_error(an_atom),
 1619: 
 1620:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 1621: 
 1622:     do_on_load_error({something,terrible,is,wrong}),
 1623:     receive
 1624: 	Any1 ->
 1625: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1626: 		   [on_load_error,
 1627: 		    {something,terrible,is,wrong},_]} = Any1
 1628:     end,
 1629: 
 1630:     do_on_load_error(fail),		%Cause exception.
 1631:     receive
 1632: 	Any2 ->
 1633: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1634: 		   [on_load_error,{failed,[_|_]},_]} = Any2
 1635:     end,
 1636: 
 1637:     %% There should be no more messages.
 1638:     receive
 1639: 	Unexpected ->
 1640: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1641:     after 10 ->
 1642: 	    ok
 1643:     end,
 1644: 
 1645:     %% Make sure that the code loading functions return the correct
 1646:     %% error code.
 1647:     Simple = simple_on_load_error,
 1648:     SimpleList = atom_to_list(Simple),
 1649:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_file(Simple),
 1650:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:ensure_loaded(Simple),
 1651:     {ok,SimpleCode} = file:read_file("simple_on_load_error.beam"),
 1652:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Simple, "", SimpleCode),
 1653:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList),
 1654:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList, Simple),
 1655: 
 1656:     ok.
 1657: 
 1658: do_on_load_error(ReturnValue) ->
 1659:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1660: 					  exit(on_load_error:main())
 1661: 				  end),
 1662:     receive {on_load_error,ErrorPid} -> ok end,
 1663:     ErrorPid ! ReturnValue,
 1664:     receive
 1665: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Exit} ->
 1666: 	    {undef,[{on_load_error,main,[],_}|_]} = Exit
 1667:     end.
 1668: 
 1669: on_load_update(Config) ->
 1670:     {Mod,Code1} = on_load_update_code(1),
 1671:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1672:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1673:     100 = Mod:b(99),
 1674:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, true),
 1675: 
 1676:     {Mod,Code2} = on_load_update_code(2),
 1677:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1678:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1679:     78 = Mod:b(77),
 1680:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1681:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, false),
 1682: 
 1683:     {Mod,Code3} = on_load_update_code(3),
 1684:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code3),
 1685:     100 = Mod:c(),
 1686:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:a()),
 1687:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:b(10)),
 1688:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1689: 
 1690:     code:purge(Mod),
 1691:     code:delete(Mod),
 1692:     code:purge(Mod),
 1693:     ok.
 1694: 
 1695: on_load_update_code(Version) ->
 1696:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1697:     Tree = on_load_update_code_1(Version, Mod),
 1698:     io:format("Version ~p", [Version]),
 1699:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1700:     merl:print(Tree),
 1701:     io:nl(),
 1702:     {Mod,Code}.
 1703: 
 1704: on_load_update_code_1(1, Mod) ->
 1705:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1706: 	"-export([a/0,b/1]).\n"
 1707: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1708: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1709: 	"a() -> 42.\n"
 1710: 	"b(I) -> I+1.\n"]);
 1711: on_load_update_code_1(2, Mod) ->
 1712:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1713: 	"-export([never/0]).\n"
 1714: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1715: 	"f() -> 42 = '@Mod@':a(), 1 = '@Mod@':b(0), fail.\n",
 1716: 	"never() -> never.\n"]);
 1717: on_load_update_code_1(3, Mod) ->
 1718:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1719: 	"-export([c/0]).\n"
 1720: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1721: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1722: 	"c() -> 100.\n"]).
 1723: 
 1724: %% Test -on_load while trace feature 'on_load' is enabled (OTP-14612)
 1725: on_load_trace_on_load(Config) ->
 1726:     %% 'on_load' enables tracing for all newly loaded modules, so we make a dry
 1727:     %% run to ensure that ancillary modules like 'merl' won't be loaded during
 1728:     %% the actual test.
 1729:     on_load_update(Config),
 1730: 
 1731:     Papa = self(),
 1732:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun F() -> receive M -> Papa ! M end, F() end),
 1733:     {tracer,[]} = erlang:trace_info(self(),tracer),
 1734:     erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, {tracer, Tracer}]),
 1735:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, true, []),
 1736:     on_load_update(Config),
 1737:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, false, []),
 1738:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
 1739: 
 1740:     Ms = flush(),
 1741:     [{trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, a, []}},
 1742:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, b, [99]}},
 1743:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, c, []}}] = Ms,
 1744: 
 1745:     exit(Tracer, normal),
 1746:     ok.
 1747: 
 1748: flush() ->
 1749:     receive M -> [M | flush()]
 1750:     after 100 -> []
 1751:     end.
 1752: 
 1753: on_load_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1754:     run_purge_test(fun on_load_purge_test/1, Config).
 1755: 
 1756: on_load_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1757:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1758:     register(Mod, self()),
 1759:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1760: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1761: 	       "loop() -> loop().\n",
 1762: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1763: 	       "'@Mod@' ! {self(),spawn(fun loop/0)},\n",
 1764: 	       "receive Ack -> Ack end.\n"]),
 1765:     merl:print(Tree),
 1766:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1767:     P = spawn(fun() ->
 1768: 		      exit(code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code))
 1769: 	      end),
 1770:     monitor(process, P),
 1771:     receive
 1772: 	{Pid1,Pid2} ->
 1773: 	    monitor(process, Pid2),
 1774: 	    Pid1 ! ack_and_failure,
 1775: 	    receive
 1776: 		{'DOWN',_,process,P,Exit1} ->
 1777: 		    {error,on_load_failure} = Exit1
 1778: 	    end,
 1779: 	    receive
 1780: 		{'DOWN',_,process,Pid2,Exit2} ->
 1781: 		    io:format("~p\n", [Exit2])
 1782: 	    after 10000 ->
 1783: 		    ct:fail(no_down_message)
 1784: 	    end
 1785:     end,
 1786:     unregister(Mod),
 1787:     ok.
 1788: 
 1789: on_load_self_call(_Config) ->
 1790:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1791:     register(Mod, self()),
 1792:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1793: 	       "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1794: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1795: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1796: 	       "  '@Mod@' ! (catch '@Mod@':ext()),\n",
 1797: 	       "  ok.\n",
 1798: 	       "ext() -> good_work.\n"]),
 1799:         merl:print(Tree),
 1800:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1801: 
 1802:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1803:     good_work = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1804: 
 1805:     ok.
 1806: 
 1807: on_load_do_load(Mod, Code) ->
 1808:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1809:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1810:                end),
 1811:     receive
 1812: 	Any -> Any
 1813:     end.
 1814: 
 1815: on_load_pending(_Config) ->
 1816:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1817:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1818: 		"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1819: 		"f() ->\n",
 1820: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1821: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1822:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1823:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1824: 
 1825:     Tree2 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1826: 		"-export([t/0]).\n",
 1827: 		"t() -> ok.\n"]),
 1828:     merl:print(Tree2),
 1829:     {ok,Mod,Code2} = merl:compile(Tree2),
 1830: 
 1831:     Self = self(),
 1832:     {_,Ref1} =
 1833: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1834: 			      Self ! started1,
 1835: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1)
 1836: 		      end),
 1837:     receive started1 -> ok end,
 1838:     timer:sleep(10),
 1839:     {_,Ref2} =
 1840: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1841: 			      Self ! started2,
 1842: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1843: 			      ok = Mod:t()
 1844: 		      end),
 1845:     receive started2 -> ok end,
 1846:     receive
 1847: 	Unexpected ->
 1848: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1849:     after 100 ->
 1850: 	    ok
 1851:     end,
 1852:     Mod ! go,
 1853:     receive
 1854: 	{'DOWN',Ref1,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1855:     end,
 1856:     receive
 1857: 	{'DOWN',Ref2,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1858:     end,
 1859:     ok = Mod:t(),
 1860:     ok.
 1861: 
 1862: on_load_deleted(_Config) ->
 1863:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1864: 
 1865:     R0 = fun() ->
 1866: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1867: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1868: 			    "f() -> ok.\n"]),
 1869: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1870: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1871: 		 {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1872: 	 end,
 1873:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1874:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1875: 
 1876:     R1 = fun() ->
 1877: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1878: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1879: 			    "f() -> fail.\n"]),
 1880: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1881: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1882: 		 {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1883: 	 end,
 1884:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1885:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1886: 
 1887:     OtherMod = list_to_atom(lists:concat([Mod,"_42"])),
 1888:     OtherTree = ?Q(["-module('@OtherMod@').\n"]),
 1889:     merl:print(OtherTree),
 1890:     {ok,OtherMod,OtherCode} = merl:compile(OtherTree),
 1891: 
 1892:     R2 = fun() ->
 1893: 		 RegName = 'on_load__registered_name',
 1894: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1895: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1896: 			    "f() ->\n",
 1897: 			    "  register('@RegName@', self()),\n",
 1898: 			    "  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1899: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1900: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1901: 		 spawn_link(fun() ->
 1902:                                     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1903:                             end),
 1904: 		 receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1905: 		 {module,OtherMod} = code:load_binary(OtherMod, "",
 1906: 						      OtherCode),
 1907: 		 RegName ! stop
 1908: 	 end,
 1909:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R2),
 1910: 
 1911:     ok.
 1912: 
 1913: on_load_deadlock(Config) ->
 1914:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1915:     register(Mod, self()),
 1916:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1917:                "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1918:                "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1919:                "f() ->\n",
 1920:                "  timer:sleep(1000),\n",
 1921:                "  '@Mod@':ext().\n",
 1922:                "ext() -> ok.\n"]),
 1923:     merl:print(Tree),
 1924:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1925: 
 1926:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1927:     File = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam"),
 1928:     ok = file:write_file(File, Code),
 1929:     code:add_path(Dir),
 1930: 
 1931:     spawn(fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(Mod) end),
 1932:     {error,Reason} = code:ensure_loaded(Mod),
 1933:     true = (Reason =:= deadlock) or (Reason =:= on_load_failure),
 1934: 
 1935:     code:del_path(Dir),
 1936:     ok.
 1937: 
 1938: delete_before_reload(Mod, Reload) ->
 1939:     false = check_old_code(Mod),
 1940: 
 1941:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1942: 		"-export([f/1]).\n",
 1943: 		"f(Parent) ->\n",
 1944: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1945: 		"  Parent ! started,\n",
 1946: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1947:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1948:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1949: 
 1950:     Self = self(),
 1951:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1952:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1953:                        Mod:f(Self)
 1954:                end),
 1955:     receive started -> ok end,
 1956: 
 1957:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1958:     true = check_old_code(Mod),
 1959: 
 1960:     Reload(),
 1961: 
 1962:     %% When loading the the module with the -on_load() function,
 1963:     %% the reference to the old code would be lost. Make sure that
 1964:     %% the old code is remembered and is still preventing the
 1965:     %% purge.
 1966:     false = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1967: 
 1968:     %% Get rid of the old code.
 1969:     Mod ! stop,
 1970:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1971:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1972: 
 1973:     %% Unload the version of the module with the -on_load() function.
 1974:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1975:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1976: 
 1977:     ok.
 1978: 
 1979: %% Test that the mode of the code server is properly retrieved.
 1980: get_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1981:     interactive = code:get_mode().
 1982: 
 1983: %% Make sure that the paths for all loaded modules have been normalized.
 1984: normalized_paths(_Config) ->
 1985:     do_normalized_paths(erlang:loaded()).
 1986: 
 1987: do_normalized_paths([M|Ms]) ->
 1988:     case code:which(M) of
 1989: 	Special when is_atom(Special) ->
 1990: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms);
 1991: 	File when is_list(File) ->
 1992: 	    File = filename:join([File]),
 1993: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms)
 1994:     end;
 1995: do_normalized_paths([]) ->
 1996:     ok.
 1997: 
 1998: %% Make sure that the extra -mode flags are ignored
 1999: mult_embedded_flags(_Config) ->
 2000:     Modes = [{["-mode", "embedded"], embedded},
 2001: 	     {["-mode", "interactive"], interactive},
 2002: 	     {["-mode", "invalid"], interactive}],
 2003: 
 2004:     [ begin
 2005: 	  {ArgMode, ExpectedMode} = Mode,
 2006: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgMode),
 2007: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 2008: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 2009:       end || Mode <- Modes],
 2010: 
 2011:     [ begin
 2012: 	  {ArgIgnoredMode, _} = IgnoredMode,
 2013: 	  {ArgRelevantMode, ExpectedMode} = RelevantMode,
 2014: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgRelevantMode ++ ArgIgnoredMode),
 2015: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 2016: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 2017:       end || IgnoredMode <- Modes, RelevantMode <- Modes],
 2018:     ok.
 2019: 
 2020: %% Test that module_status/1 behaves as expected
 2021: module_status(_Config) ->
 2022:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 2023:         true ->
 2024:             module_status();
 2025:         false ->
 2026:             %% Make sure that we terminate the cover server.
 2027:             try
 2028:                 module_status()
 2029:             after
 2030:                 cover:stop()
 2031:             end
 2032:     end.
 2033: 
 2034: module_status() ->
 2035:     %% basics
 2036:     not_loaded = code:module_status(fubar),     % nonexisting
 2037:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(erlang),
 2038:     loaded = code:module_status(erlang),        % preloaded
 2039:     loaded = code:module_status(?MODULE),       % normal known loaded
 2040: 
 2041:     %% module_status/0 returns status for each loaded module
 2042:     true = (lists:sort([{M, code:module_status(M)}
 2043:                         || {M, _} <- code:all_loaded()])
 2044:             =:= lists:sort(code:module_status())),
 2045: 
 2046:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
 2047:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
 2048:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2049:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2050: 
 2051:     %% generated code is detected as such
 2052:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
 2053:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_binary(?TESTMOD,"",Bin),  % no source file
 2054:     ok = ?TESTMOD:f(),
 2055:     "" = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify empty string for source file
 2056:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2057: 
 2058:     %% module_status/1 also accepts a list of modules
 2059:     [] = code:module_status([]),
 2060:     [{erlang, loaded},{?MODULE,loaded},{?TESTMOD,loaded}] =
 2061:         code:module_status([erlang, ?MODULE, ?TESTMOD]),
 2062: 
 2063:     %% deleting generated code
 2064:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2065:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify still not in path
 2066:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2067: 
 2068:     %% beam file exists but not loaded
 2069:     make_source_file(<<"0">>),
 2070:     compile_beam(0),
 2071:     true = (non_existing =/= code:which(?TESTMOD)), % verify in path
 2072:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2073: 
 2074:     %% loading code from disk makes it loaded
 2075:     load_code(),
 2076:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded
 2077: 
 2078:     %% cover compiling a module
 2079:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = cover:compile(?TESTMOD),
 2080:     {file, cover_compiled} = code:is_loaded(?TESTMOD), % verify cover compiled
 2081:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded cover code but file exists
 2082:     remove_code(),
 2083:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % removed
 2084:     compile_beam(0),
 2085:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % recreated
 2086:     load_code(),
 2087:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loading removes cover status
 2088:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2089:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2090:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % deleted
 2091: 
 2092:     %% recompilation ignores timestamps, only md5 matters
 2093:     load_code(),
 2094:     compile_beam(1100),
 2095:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2096: 
 2097:     %% modifying module detects different md5
 2098:     make_source_file(<<"1">>),
 2099:     compile_beam(0),
 2100:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2101: 
 2102:     %% loading the modified code from disk makes it loaded
 2103:     load_code(),
 2104:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2105: 
 2106:     %% removing and recreating a module with same md5
 2107:     remove_code(),
 2108:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2109:     compile_beam(0),
 2110:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2111: 
 2112:     ok.
 2113: 
 2114: compile_beam(Sleep) ->
 2115:     compile(Sleep, []).
 2116: 
 2117: compile(Sleep, Opts) ->
 2118:     timer:sleep(Sleep),  % increment compilation timestamp
 2119:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = compile:file(?TESTMODSRC, Opts).
 2120: 
 2121: load_code() ->
 2122:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2123:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_file(?TESTMOD).
 2124: 
 2125: remove_code() ->
 2126:     ok = file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ).
 2127: 
 2128: make_source_file(Body) ->
 2129:     ok = file:write_file(?TESTMODSRC, dummy_source(Body)).
 2130: 
 2131: dummy_source(Body) ->
 2132:     [<<"-module(" ?TESTMODSTR ").\n"
 2133:        "-export([f/0]).\n"
 2134:        "f() -> ">>, Body, <<".\n">>].
 2135: 
 2136: dummy_ast() ->
 2137:     dummy_ast(?TESTMODSTR).
 2138: 
 2139: dummy_ast(Mod) when is_atom(Mod) ->
 2140:     dummy_ast(atom_to_list(Mod));
 2141: dummy_ast(ModStr) ->
 2142:     [scan_form("-module(" ++ ModStr ++ ")."),
 2143:      scan_form("-export([f/0])."),
 2144:      scan_form("f() -> ok.")].
 2145: 
 2146: scan_form(String) ->
 2147:     {ok,Ts,_} = erl_scan:string(String),
 2148:     {ok,F} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
 2149:     F.
 2150: 
 2151: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2152: %% error_logger handler.
 2153: %% (Copied from stdlib/test/proc_lib_SUITE.erl.)
 2154: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2155: init(Tester) ->
 2156:     {ok, Tester}.
 2157: 
 2158: handle_event({warning_msg, _GL, Msg}, Tester) ->
 2159:     Tester ! Msg,
 2160:     {ok, Tester};
 2161: handle_event(_Event, State) ->
 2162:     {ok, State}.
 2163: 
 2164: handle_info(_, State) ->
 2165:     {ok, State}.
 2166: 
 2167: handle_call(_Query, State) -> {ok, {error, bad_query}, State}.
 2168: 
 2169: terminate(_Reason, State) ->
 2170:     State.
 2171: 
 2172: %%%
 2173: %%% Common utility functions.
 2174: %%%
 2175: 
 2176: run_purge_test(Test, Config) ->
 2177:     OSRL = erlang:system_info(outstanding_system_requests_limit),
 2178:     
 2179:     TestLowOSRL = case OSRL < 10 of
 2180:                       true -> 1;
 2181:                       false -> 5
 2182:                   end,
 2183: 
 2184:     io:format("Running with the default outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [OSRL]),
 2185:     Res1 = Test(Config),
 2186:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res1]),
 2187:     try
 2188:         %% Run again with low limit and many processes...
 2189:         Procs = case erlang:system_info(process_limit) of
 2190:                     PLim when PLim < 20000 ->
 2191:                         erlang:system_info(process_limit) div 2;
 2192:                     _ ->
 2193:                         10000
 2194:                 end,
 2195:         erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, TestLowOSRL),
 2196:         io:format("Running with outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [TestLowOSRL]),
 2197:         Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2198:                                spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end)
 2199:                        end, lists:seq(1, Procs)),
 2200:         Res2 = Test(Config),
 2201:         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 2202:                               unlink(P),
 2203:                               exit(P, kill)
 2204:                       end, Ps),
 2205:         lists:foreach(fun (P) -> is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
 2206:         io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res2]),
 2207:         {Res1, Res2}
 2208:     after
 2209:         TestLowOSRL = erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, OSRL)
 2210:     end.
